---
title: |
  Digital Archaeology Maintainathon\
subtitle: "Let's clean, document and revisit older code and data, together!"
# description: "#DigiArchMaintainathon"
---

::: {.summary}
1. Put in the work
2. Post about it [#DigiArchMaintainathon](https://archaeo.social/tags/DigiArchMaintainathon){.hashtag}
3. Reflect and discuss
4. That's it!
:::

### [[Some things you can do to participate:](https://sslarch.github.io/maintainathon/resources)]{style="color: #ab4642;"}{.no-anchor}

<div style=" columns: 2; -webkit-columns: 2; -moz-columns: 2;">
- Add comments to old code or code in progress
- Write a better README
- Archive your code in long-term repository
- Add an open license
- Add a citation file to your repo
- Write contributor guidelines
- Develop a project roadmap
- Acknowledge contributors
- List your code in a community registry
- Write a code review
- Browse critical research on software development practices
- Donate to FOSS projects

</div>
